description.narrative: Det föreslagna stödet under åren 2015-2017 till Nile Equatorial Lakes Subsidiary Action Program Regional Project Coordination Unit (NELSAP RPCU) har två mål. Det första är att RPCU:n ska finansieras så att det kan avsluta det arbete som enheten har varit involverad i vad gäller det så kallade Ínterconnection projektet, vilket omfattar en rad kraftledningar som kopplar samman elnäten mellan Burundi, Demokratiska Republiken Kongo, Kenya, Rwanda och Uganda. NELSAPs roll i detta projekt är att koordinera och facilitera mellan de olika aktörerna som är inblandade, att genomföra och stödja upphandling av konsulter, studier etc., att erbjuda tekniskt stöd, genomföra kapacitetsbedömningar i varje land osv. I steg två föreslås NELSAPs RPCU att utarbeta en långsiktig plan för hur enheten kan etablera sig som ett Center of Excellence för energi i regionen och vara den aktör som finansiärer kommer till när det gäller förberedande arbete i stora energiprojekt. Sverige föreslås bidra med 5 miljoner SEK under 2015-2016 för genomförandet av detta.

The proposed support to Nile Equatorial Lakes Subsidiary Action Program Regional Project Coordination Unit (NELSAP RPCU) has a two fold aim. The first is that the RPCU will have the funding to finalize the work NELSAP RPCU is providing to the Interconnection project, which is a series of transmission lines between the following countries:Burundi, Democratic Republic of Congo, Kenya, Rwanda and Uganda. NELSAPs role in this project is to coordinate and faciliate between the different actors as well as to conduct the necessary procurements, provide technical support, undertake capacity assessments in each country etc. Furthermore, the NELSAP RPCU will develop a long term plan for the organisation to establish a Center of Excellence for energy in East Africa.

The intervention intends to fund the Regional Project Coordination Unit (RPCU) under NELSAP to implement the Interconnection Project and in doing this, enable regional power trade to take place. The intervention will also allow the NELSAP RPCU to develop a long term plan for the unit, on how to become a Center of Excellence for energy in East Africa. This will facilitate for investors in power production to enter the market, enable more electricity being produced and thus boost economiv activities in the region.

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

tag.narrative: 7.b - By 2030, expand infrastructure and upgrade technology for supplying modern and sustainable energy services for all in developing countries, in particular least developed countries, small island developing States and landlocked developing countries, in accordance with their respective programmes of support.

7.b - Till 2030 bygga ut infrastrukturen och uppgradera tekniken för att leverera moderna och hållbara energitjänster till alla i utvecklingsländerna, i synnerhet de minst utvecklade länderna och små önationer under utveckling.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The contribution allowed NELSAP to finance a coordination team for several investments in transmission lines in the Great Lake region. The investment projects were however seriously delayed due to bancrupcy of the contractor. In Rwanda, the military completed project work while in Uganda there is still uncertainties on the completion of work. The Swedish support funds run out and the financing had to be stopped. All in all the support has contributed to bring several projects close to completion.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
